channel.title: Latest PHMSA Hazardous Materials Incident Reports, for MI
channel.description: The latest Form 5800.1 hazardous material reports submitted to the Department of Transportation and posted online by the Pipeline and Hazardous Materials Safety Administration, for MI

item.title: Report X-2024040570
item.description:
Report X-2024040570

Identified by scraper @ 2024-04-19T15:12:40+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-04-05
  • City: SAGINAW
  • State: MI
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: Fedex Ground Package System, Inc.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 0
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: SequenceEvent: Found box on floor next to outbound QA desk, observed small amount of white crystal like substance on floor by bottom of box. Using PPE placed box into red hazmat tote to take to QA area for inspection DescribePack: Using PPE, which included gloves, opened box and found 50 lb. plastic pail containing Oxidizer which upon further inspection found large crack on the bottom of the plastic pail which allowed approximately 4 ounces of oxidizer to leak into bottom of box. DurationRel: 1 and MitigateEffect: Immediately contained box and contents into red Hazmat tote and removed from area to QA cage for inspection, after QA inspection took red tote to the Hazmat cage to await disposition.

  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 0
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: SequenceEvent: The package was found in the unload area wet and leaking. Proper PPE was used to remove the package and it was placed into a hazmat bin. Upon inspection I found that one of the bottles had a loose cap which led to the leakage. DescribePack: Upon inspection I found that one of the bottles had a loose cap which led to the leakage. DurationRel: 1 and MitigateEffect: Proper PPE was used to remove the package and it was placed into a hazmat bin.

item.description:
Report X-2024040575

  • Incident Date: 2024-04-03
  • City: GRAND RAPIDS
  • State: MI
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: Fedex Ground Package System, Inc.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 0
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: SequenceEvent: DAMAGED LEAKING HAZMAT PAIL WAS FOUND IN THE UNLOAD AND BROUGHT OVER FOR INSPECTION. UPON INSPECTION IT WAS FOUND TO BE A DAMAGED HAZMAT AND THE HAZMAT PROCESS WAS STARTED. DescribePack: THE TOP OF THE PAIL IS DENTED AND WHEN TIPPED ON ITS SIDE IT DOES LEAK. DurationRel: 1 and MitigateEffect: PAIL WAS TURNED UP RIGHT.

item.title: Report X-2024040621
item.description:
Report X-2024040621

Identified by scraper @ 2024-04-18T18:14:13+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-04-08
  • City: GRAND RAPIDS
  • State: MI
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: Fedex Ground Package System, Inc.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 0
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: SequenceEvent: The wet box was found in unload and was placed in a plastic lined damaged Hazmat tote and brought to QA for inspection. Upon inspection it was discovered that one of the glass bottles of the Honeywell Methanol was broken inside the shipping box. All the proper procedures were followed. DescribePack: The 4L glass bottle of Methanol was broken inside the shipping box. DurationRel: 1 and MitigateEffect: The wet box was put in a plastic lined Hazmat tote and brought to QA for inspection.

item.title: Report X-2024040528
item.description:
Report X-2024040528

Identified by scraper @ 2024-04-17T15:16:09+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-04-04
  • City: LAKE ORION
  • State: MI
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: Fedex Ground Package System, Inc.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 0
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: SequenceEvent: QA was made aware that there was leaking hazmat on the ground. QA was told that the driver had the package on their truck from the previous day and that when he opened up his side door the package fell out of his truck and onto the ground. The package was put into a plastic lined bin. QA stopped the continued downhill movement of the liquid with absorbent pads. The liquid was tested and came up acidic. Neutralizer was put onto the spill until it came up as non-acidic. Loose particulate was then placed on the spill area to absorb the liquid. DescribePack: The cap was loose on one of the jugs. The cap fell off after the package fell out of the drivers truck. DurationRel: 1 and MitigateEffect: Neutralizer was used to negate the acid in the liquid. Loose particulate was placed on the spill.
